org.ojai

Interface DocumentReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DocumentReaderBase, DocumentReaderWithProjection

    @API.Public
 @API.NotThreadSafe
public interface DocumentReader

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  DocumentReader.EventType

      DocumentReader.EventType next()
      Moves the DocumentReader to the next node and returns the node type as EventType.
      DocumentReader skipChildren()
      When called after DocumentReader.EventType.START_MAP or DocumentReader.EventType.START_ARRAY event, moves this DocumentReader to the corresponding DocumentReader.EventType.END_MAP or DocumentReader.EventType.END_ARRAY, skipping the entire sub-tree.

    • Method Detail

      • next

        DocumentReader.EventType next()
        Moves the DocumentReader to the next node and returns the node type as EventType.
        Returns:
        the EventType for the current node or null if the reader is past the end of the document
        Throws:
        DecodingException - if the document is malformed or incomplete.

      • getCurrentEvent

        DocumentReader.EventType getCurrentEvent()
        Returns:
        the event emitted by the last call to next()

      • skipChildren

        DocumentReader skipChildren()
        When called after DocumentReader.EventType.START_MAP or DocumentReader.EventType.START_ARRAY event, moves this DocumentReader to the corresponding DocumentReader.EventType.END_MAP or DocumentReader.EventType.END_ARRAY, skipping the entire sub-tree.

        For all other events, this is a NO-OP.

        Returns:
        this for chaining

      • inMap

        boolean inMap()
        Returns:
        true while traversing a Map, false if traversing an Array

      • getFieldName

        String getFieldName()
        Returns:
        the name of the current field, null for the top level Document
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the reader is not traversing a Map

      • getArrayIndex

        int getArrayIndex()
        Returns:
        the index of the current element in the Array
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the reader is not traversing an Array

      • getByte

        byte getByte()
        Returns:
        the byte value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not BYTE

      • getShort

        short getShort()
        Returns:
        the byte value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not SHORT.

      • getInt

        int getInt()
        Returns:
        the int value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not INT

      • getLong

        long getLong()
        Returns:
        the long value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not LONG

      • getFloat

        float getFloat()
        Returns:
        the float value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not FLOAT

      • getDouble

        double getDouble()
        Returns:
        the double value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not DOUBLE

      • getDecimal

        BigDecimal getDecimal()
        Returns:
        the BigDecimal value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not DECIMAL

      • getDecimalPrecision

        int getDecimalPrecision()
        Returns the precision of the current DECIMAL node. (The precision is the number of digits in the unscaled value.)

        The precision of a zero value is 1.

        Returns:
        the precision of current DECIMAL node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not DECIMAL

      • getDecimalScale

        int getDecimalScale()
        Returns the scale of the current DECIMAL node. If the returned value is zero or positive, the scale is the number of digits to the right of the decimal point. If negative, the unscaled value of the number is multiplied by ten to the power of the negation of the scale. For example, a scale of -3 means the unscaled value is multiplied by 1000.
        Returns:
        the scale of current DECIMAL node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not DECIMAL

      • getDecimalValueAsInt

        int getDecimalValueAsInt()
        Returns an int whose value is the unscaled value of this DECIMAL.
        Returns:
        the unscaled value of current DECIMAL node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not DECIMAL
        RangeException - if the precision of the decimal number is greater than 9

      • getDecimalValueAsLong

        long getDecimalValueAsLong()
        Returns a long whose value is the unscaled value of this DECIMAL.
        Returns:
        the unscaled value of current DECIMAL node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not DECIMAL
        RangeException - if the precision of the decimal number is greater than 18

      • getDecimalValueAsBytes

        ByteBuffer getDecimalValueAsBytes()
        Returns a ByteBuffer containing the two's complement representation of the current DECIMAL node. The byte array will be in big-endian byte order: the most significant byte is in the zeroth element. The array will contain the minimum number of bytes required to represent this DECIMAL, including one sign bit.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the two's complement representation of current DECIMAL node

      • getBoolean

        boolean getBoolean()
        Returns:
        the boolean value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not BOOLEAN

      • getString

        String getString()
        Returns:
        the String value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not STRING

      • getTimestampLong

        long getTimestampLong()
        Returns:
        the Timestamp value of the current node as a long representing the number of milliseconds since epoch
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not TIMESTAMP

      • getTimestamp

        OTimestamp getTimestamp()
        Returns:
        the Timestamp value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not TIMESTAMP

      • getDateInt

        int getDateInt()
        Returns:
        the Date value of the current node as an int representing the number of DAYS since epoch
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not DATE

      • getDate

        ODate getDate()
        Returns:
        the Date value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not DATE

      • getTimeInt

        int getTimeInt()
        Returns:
        the Time value of the current node as an int representing the number of milliseconds since midnight.
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not TIME

      • getTime

        OTime getTime()
        Returns:
        the Time value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not TIME

      • getInterval

        OInterval getInterval()
        Returns:
        the Interval value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not INTERVAL

      • getIntervalDays

        int getIntervalDays()

      • getIntervalMillis

        long getIntervalMillis()

      • getBinary

        ByteBuffer getBinary()
        Returns:
        the ByteBuffer value of the current node
        Throws:
        TypeException - if the current EventType is not BINARY
